metadata.synopsis: Dialog with the Gur Leader after you defeated Cazador
metadata.how_to_trigger: Origin Debug Book (Ctrl+Shift+7)Astarion - Origin Moments - Gur Follow-upWalk towards the Gur Leader

10.speaker: Ulma
10.context: NodeContext: With an air of arrogance

19.speaker: Astarion
19.text: Spawn? I am the Vampire Ascendant, Gur. And I thought I was done with your wretched little tribe.
19.context: NodeContext: With an air of arrogance

61.speaker: Ulma
61.text: We're not done. Not even close.
61.context: NodeContext: Introducing yourself to Astarion's Companions

74.speaker: Ulma
74.text: My name's Ulma, my people are monster hunters. Those of us that remain, that is.
74.context: NodeContext: Introducing yourself to Astarion's Companions

51.speaker: Ulma
51.text: Your companion attacked us in the night and stole our children. Then his master decimated what was left of the tribe.
51.context: NodeContext: With an air of arrogance

78.speaker: Astarion
78.text: You can't blame a spawn for the sins of his master. Any good monster hunter should know that.
78.context: NodeContext: With an air of arrogance

63.speaker: Astarion
63.text: I had no choice. As you 'monster hunters' well know.
63.context: NodeContext: This line could be followed by an aggressive line ("one blood-sucking beast replaced with another") or an impressed line ("you killed not only Cazador, but also his wretched creations.") so it needs to be tonally neutral

103.speaker: Ulma
103.text: True. So imagine my surprise when I heard you'd fled. Heard you were a rogue spawn, free from Cazador's control.
103.context: NodeContext: This line could be followed by an aggressive line ("one blood-sucking beast replaced with another") or an impressed line ("you killed not only Cazador, but also his wretched creations.") so it needs to be tonally neutral

65.speaker: Ulma
65.text: We searched half the Sword Coast for you, hoping you could help us destroy him, only to track you right back here.
65.context: NodeContext: This line could be followed by an aggressive line ("one blood-sucking beast replaced with another") or an impressed line ("you killed not only Cazador, but also his wretched creations.") so it needs to be tonally neutral

53.speaker: Ulma
53.text: And what do we find when we arrive?
53.context: NodeContext: This line could be followed by an aggressive line ("one blood-sucking beast replaced with another") or an impressed line ("you killed not only Cazador, but also his wretched creations.") so it needs to be tonally neutral

25.speaker: Ulma
25.text: One blood-sucking beast replaced with another. Our children sacrificed to birth a monster.

87.speaker: Astarion
87.text: You're - the Gur tribe? I thought I was done with you people.
87.context: NodeContext: Unexpected ghost from your past

59.speaker: Ulma
59.text: You killed one vampire, but released seven thousand of his spawn? Have you lost all sense?

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: They were innocents. To kill them would have been an even greater crime.

73.speaker: Astarion
73.text: But if you do decide to go hunting them, know they include your children.

91.speaker: Astarion
91.text: That depends on how you define 'survived', really, but they are free. They're making their way into the Underdark as we speak.

28.speaker: Ulma
28.text: And our children? What of their fate?

81.speaker: Astarion
81.text: Cazador turned everyone we brought him into spawn. I can only assume your children were somewhere in those wretched cells.

30.speaker: Astarion
30.text: You'll find them in the Underdark, although you may not like what you find.

40.speaker: Ulma
40.text: This is... difficult news. We will need to decide what it means.

22.speaker: Ulma
22.text: Thank you for what you have done - slaying Cazador was a great justice. As for the rest... well, time will tell.

62.speaker: Ulma
62.text: I had hoped to avoid this path. I had hoped you would choose the better road.

23.speaker: Ulma
23.text: A fool I was, to ever hope a beast like you could be saved.

36.speaker: Astarion
36.text: Oh please, there's no need for such language. I promised you Cazador's death and I more than delivered.

71.speaker: Astarion
71.text: I even killed a few thousand spawn while I was at it - you should be thanking me for saving you the trouble.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: We don't have to fight. We can work together.

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: No, there's no working with the likes of them. Look at the hate in their eyes.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I need Astarion strong to save the city. This is the lesser evil, I promise.

70.speaker: Ulma
70.text: There is no greater or lesser, there is only evil. And it stands before me.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Walk away, Ulma. Your tribe doesn't need to die here.

6.speaker: Astarion
6.text: Oh I don't know - this might be the perfect place for them to die.

12.speaker: Astarion
12.text: Look at the hate in their eyes. They won't ever stop hunting me.

37.speaker: Ulma
37.text: We gave you a choice and you chose power. As your kind always does.

44.speaker: Ulma
44.text: But I still have hope for you - that you will make a better choice.

89.speaker: Ulma
89.text: Will you stand against evil. Will you help us destroy this monster?
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Over her shoulder, to the other hunters standing behind her.

68.speaker: Player
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Over her shoulder, to the other hunters standing behind her.

75.speaker: Ulma
75.text: Then you are as much a monster as he.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I can't. There has to be another way.
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Over her shoulder, to the other hunters standing behind her.

26.speaker: Ulma
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Over her shoulder, to the other hunters standing behind her.

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: My dear, I wouldn't want it any other way.
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Over her shoulder, to the other hunters standing behind her.

27.speaker: Ulma
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Over her shoulder, to the other hunters standing behind her.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: You're right, Astarion has to be stopped.

5.speaker: Astarion
5.text: What? You treacherous little shit - I'll kill you all!

95.speaker: Astarion
95.text: Please, there's no need for such language. You wanted Cazador dead and now he is.

88.speaker: Ulma
88.text: Cazador is destroyed and his plans ruined. I was not sure you could do it.

39.speaker: Astarion
39.text: I - I'm sorry. We were too late. Cazador had already turned them.

66.speaker: Astarion
66.text: You'll find them sealed in the cells below the palace. Although you might not like what you find.

94.speaker: Ulma
94.text: That being said, slaying Cazador was a great justice. You have our thanks, now and forever.

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: I - I don't know for sure, but Cazador turned everyone we brought him. I can only assume that included your children.

102.speaker: Astarion
102.text: You'll probably find them in the cells below the palace. Although you won't like what you find.

100.speaker: Ulma
100.text: You killed not only Cazador, but also his wretched creations. I expected less.

34.speaker: Astarion
34.text: So I can see from all your heavily-armed friends. You didn't think I could resist completing the ritual, did you?

21.speaker: Ulma
21.text: I admit, I had my doubts.

92.speaker: Ulma
92.text: But where are our children? What of their fate?

98.speaker: Player
98.text: We were too late. Cazador killed them.

49.speaker: Ulma
49.text: A monster. A truly wretched monster.

57.speaker: Ulma
57.text: A monster. A truly wretched monster.

90.speaker: Ulma
90.text: But thanks to you, a monster that will never rear its head again. You have our thanks.

97.speaker: Ulma
97.text: You are free - never again will you be hunted by my people.

60.speaker: Astarion
60.text: Thank you. And for what it's worth - I'm sorry. I wish I could return the ones taken from you.

96.speaker: Ulma
96.text: You gave them peace. There was nothing more we could ask of you.

99.text: You lie to cover your sins? To blame the vampire for your choices?

7.speaker: Ulma
7.text: You lie to cover your sins? To blame the vampire for your choices?

79.speaker: Ulma
79.text: And worse, you thought we would not know? You are hardly better than the beast you slew.

84.speaker: Astarion
84.text: But we did slay him, so... how about we call it even?

56.speaker: Ulma
56.text: However twisted, there is a logic there... Very well.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: They died as vampire spawn. It was the only mercy we could give them.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: They likely died as vampire spawn. Which is probably a mercy, honestly.

64.speaker: Ulma
64.text: Killing children makes for a strange kind of mercy. Although given what they'd become...

43.speaker: Ulma
43.text: Killing children makes for a strange kind of mercy. Although given what they'd become...

15.speaker: Astarion
15.text: Believe me when I say it was for the best. The pain from the hunger alone - there's nothing like it.

18.text: Mercy? They were our children - mercy would have been giving us a chance to say goodbye. To decide their fate ourselves.

77.speaker: Ulma
77.text: Mercy? They were our children - mercy would have been giving us a chance to say goodbye. To decide their fate ourselves.

58.speaker: Astarion
58.text: You think that's what you wanted, but you don't know the hunger. You don't know what it turns us into.

9.speaker: Ulma
9.text: And you don't know the scar you've left in our tribe, spawn.

24.speaker: Ulma
24.text: But you have rid this land of your old master, so... consider things settled between us.

35.speaker: Ulma
35.text: We will not hunt you, but you will never be welcome around our fire.

11.speaker: Astarion
11.text: Oh, I wasn't holding out for an invitation.

76.speaker: Ulma
76.text: So when you destroyed the spawn, you killed them too?

85.speaker: Astarion
85.text: They died long before we arrived. Trust me, they were not the children you knew.

13.speaker: Ulma
13.text: Perhaps, but the choice should still have been ours. You have taken them from us twice now.

52.speaker: Astarion
52.text: I have. I've stolen your last chance to see them, and I'd do it again in a heartbeat.

82.speaker: Astarion
82.text: Because anything else would mean sending you down into the dark. It'd mean showing you the hunger in your babes' eyes and leaving you with that terrible, final decision.

16.speaker: Astarion
16.text: I've visited enough pain on your people. The least I could do was spare you that.

2.speaker: Ulma
2.text: Perhaps there was something to that. A kindness I would not have credited you with.

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: Well that's backhanded as compliments come. Though I'll take it if it means you're done trying to kill me.

72.speaker: Ulma
72.text: I never dreamt a spawn could find redemption, but - yes. You will never be hunted again.

38.speaker: Ulma
38.text: As for you, you have my people's thanks. I know you face trials ahead - we will stand with you as best we can.

1.speaker: Ulma
1.text: Until then, go in peace. And thank you.
